block.p: Allison Lee Hull, a daughter of Linda and Gary Hull of Sag Harbor, N.Y., was married yesterday to Brewster Jennings Brown, a son of Laura Webb Brown and Archibald M. Brown Jr. of Tucson. The Rev. Peter M. Larsen performed the ceremony at St. Andrew's Dune Episcopal Church in Southampton, N.Y.

Mrs. Brown, 27, is the assistant project manager in charge of rebates at Circuit City, the electronics consumer chain based in Richmond, Va. She graduated magna cum laude from Wake Forest University. Her father is a partner in Hull Chevrolet-Oldsmobile, an automobile dealership in Southampton. Her mother is a senior vice president of investments in the Riverhead, N.Y., office of Salomon Smith Barney. The bride is a descendant of the American composer Stephen Foster.

Allison Lee Hull, a daughter of Linda and Gary Hull of Sag Harbor, N.Y., was married yesterday to Brewster Jennings Brown, a son of Laura Webb Brown and Archibald M. Brown Jr. of Tucson. The Rev. Peter M. Larsen performed the ceremony at St. Andrew's Dune Episcopal Church in Southampton, N.Y.

Mrs. Brown, 27, is the assistant project manager in charge of rebates at Circuit City, the electronics consumer chain based in Richmond, Va. She graduated magna cum laude from Wake Forest University. Her father is a partner in Hull Chevrolet-Oldsmobile, an automobile dealership in Southampton. Her mother is a senior vice president of investments in the Riverhead, N.Y., office of Salomon Smith Barney. The bride is a descendant of the American composer Stephen Foster.

Mr. Brown, 29, is the alternate education instructor at Godwin High School in Richmond. In September he is to begin studying for a graduate degree in guidance counseling at Virginia Commonwealth University in Richmond. He graduated from Connecticut College. His father is a media consultant in Tucson.
The bridegroom is a descendant of Cornelius Vanderbilt and is a great-grandson of Electra Havemeyer Webb, the founder of the Shelburne Museum in Shelburne, Vt.
